## GAD-7 vs PCS

GAD-7 vs PCS: Harmonising Psychological Questionnaires It's important for psychologists and social scientists to be able to compare and harmonise questionnaires, such as GAD-7 and PCS, two widely used instruments within the field. They enable professionals to assess generalized anxiety disorder and peer conflict, respectively. However, comparing these questionnaires often becomes a daunting task due to the subjective and time-consuming nature of the process. 'Harmony', a state-of-the-art software, simplifies this process by using, natural language processing and generative AI models to find connections between questionnaire items in a fraction of the time. In particular, the GAD-7 vs PCS comparison, which would typically be an arduous task, can now be done with ease and accuracy. Harmony enables researchers to fetch instruments from an existing database or upload their own in PDF format. This unique feature offers flexibility and convenience, making the GAD-7 vs PCS comparison an effortless process. To ensure the broad outreach of the psychological studies, Harmony also opens the door for inter-study comparisons in multiple languages. This provides a perfect platform for testing the consistency of psychological questionnaires like GAD-7 vs PCS across various social conditions and populations. Inviting experts to utilise Harmony means saving valuable time and energy which can be redirected towards the exploration and interpretation of results. Make your GAD-7 vs PCS analysis more efficient and reliable with Harmony.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and PCS

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and PCS into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just PCS into Harmony</a> - compare PCS with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
